DOCNAME: CASE OF MARIA VIOLETA LAZARESCU v. ROMANIA
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG seized under Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on nationalisation the building situated in GPE , ORG no . CARDINAL , property of the applicant 's ancestor .

CARDINAL . On DATE company ORG , a ORG - owned company responsible for the management of property belonging to the ORG , sold a QUANTITY . m. flat of the building and the appurtenant land to the tenants , V.D and ORG , under PERSON no . LANGUAGE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant sought annulment of the contract before ORG requesting the court to declare the nationalisation of her property unlawful and to order its return to her .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG , in the operative part of a final decision , dismissed as groundless an appeal on points of law by the applicant . In the reasoning of the judgment the court considered that although the seizure was null and void the bona fide principle should apply to the tenants who bought the flat from the ORG , who at that time was its legal owner .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date the applicant lodged an application with the administrative authorities for restitution in kind of the property under PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL governing immovable property wrongfully seized by the ORG . Since she had not received any answer , she brought court proceedings against the Mayor of GPE seeking to have him ordered to issue a reasoned decision upon her request . She also claimed a DATE pecuniary penalty until execution .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld in part her action and ordered the Mayor to issue a reasoned decision regarding the restitution of the building located in GPE , ORG no . CARDINAL as the applicant requested . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the Mayor appeal . There is no evidence in the file as to the course of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The relevant legal provisions and jurisprudence are set forth in the judgments ORG v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL ) ; PERSON and Others v. GPE ( no . MONEY , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-VII ) ; GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-XII ( extracts ) ) ; and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Measures in order to urge the award of compensation through the NORP company have recently been adopted by the national authorities , especially in accordance with the Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL .
